table.description: Each lookup set is exposed as a separate virtual table in the ehr_lookups schema, making it easy to add simple value tables without having to create discrete tables in the underlying database
Methods by which a drug or other treatment may be administered
The most general categorization for animal housing, one level up from rooms
Additional services potentially available to be requested along with a blood draw, such as specific lab tests

column.columnTitle: Automatically Create Request After Blood Draw

table.description: Places from which animals might be acquired

column.description: This is the maximum blood that can be drawn per kg
This is the maximum percent of the animal's blood that can be drawn (expressed as a decimal, where 1 indicates 100%)
This is the number of days that must elapse to full reconstitute from a max blood draw
Whether the USDA tracks pain categories for this species

table.description: One-based list of months of the year
Categories of age, such as infant or adult, by species
Dictionary of SNOMED codes available for use
Mapping table to associate SNOMED codes with a particular subset (or category) of codes
Named categories of SNOMED codes, used to filter the full set for specific purposes
Modifiers to indicate that a value is out-of-range. Typically, below or above limits of detection or quantitation, etc.

table.tableTitle: SNOMED Codes Included in USDA Report
Medications That Cannot Be Administered Together

column.columnTitle: Animals Considered Paired When Separated By This Divider?

table.description: A collection of cages (can also represent outdoor enclosures)
This table lists all the types of labwork that can be ordered
This table lists all the tests expected to be generated from each lab service type
Table with rows for each day from 1950-2029 to make certain SQL queries easier
